text:
Hey guys it's Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today, as you can tell, I am dressed as Baker-Princess
Peach because I'm gonna be baking something
that I've never made on Nerdy Nummies before!

I love peach cobbler! I've been looking for
an excuse to make it, so I thought: "Why not
theme it?"
Today I'm gonna be making Princess Peach Cobbler!
Let's get started!

The things you will need will be 1/3 Cup of
old-fashioned rolled oats, 1/3 Cup of flour,

1/3 Cup of light brown sugar and 6 tablespoons
of butter.

Then for the peach filling, you're gonna need
five little peaches, one teaspoon of vanilla

extract, 2 tablespoons of the light brown
sugar and 2 tablespoons of flour.

You'll also need some ramekins because I'm
making individual size, I got these little
pink ones at Michael's.

Last but not least, you'll need two mixing
bowls. Now let's put it all together!
Peachy!

The first thing that we're gonna do is make
our peach crumble.

Soooo, gotta take off mah princess gloves
'cuz it's time to use the hands.

I bet you guys didn't know that Princess Peach
has teal nails underneath those fancy  white gloves!

That's right, that's actually her favorite
color, it's not pink, it's teal!

But the Mushroom Kingdom wouldn't
allow it, so we gotta keep it on the D-L!
All right, let's get started.

First you're gonna combine your "light" brown
sugar and your oats and your flour,

and then your butter. You're gonna take
a sharp cutting-knife and you're just gonna
cut it into a bunch of little chunks.

Then you're gonna sprinkle 'em in the bowl, little
chunks!

Now it's time for this princess to do some
manual labor!

You're gonna take your hands. Make sure you've
washed your hands, they're nice and clean! and
you're just gonna mix it all up!

You'll know it's ready when it all sticks
together, you want it to be like one chunk
of dough.

Now that we've got our crumble all mixed up,
now we're gonna put this in the refrigerator

and just let it hang out there while we make
our peach-filling!
Omm-nom-nom-nom-num! Let's go!
"Peachy!"
All right now to make our peach-filling.

The first thing that we're gonna do is cut
our peaches into little chunks.

You can cut them into slices but because we're
using the little ramekins, they just fit better
if they're peach-chunks!
You're just gonna cut all the way around,
twist 'em apart

and then you're gonna take out this little-
Is it a nut? I don't know what it is!
A seed?
A pit?
A peach-pit! That's what it is!
I'm gonna flip 'em like that,

cut the little slices first. Be careful,
don't get your fingers!

All right, then I'm gonna turn 'em this
way...

and to get chunks, then you just cut 'em
the other way.

Then you're just gonna take all these little
peach-chunks and put 'em in the bowl and do
this to the rest of your peaches.

Now we've got all the peaches cut up in the
bowl, now we are gonna add one teaspoon of
vanilla extract.

Bloop, bloop, bloop, bloop, bloop, bloop,
bloop, bloop....bewmp!

Then we're gonna add our flour- 2 tablespoons
of flour.

Then you're gonna add your brown sugar,
2 tablespoons of brown sugar.
And then you're gonna mix it up!
Just got a spoon here, just work it in!

Just keep mixing until everything is evenly
combined!

We've got our peach-filling, we've got our
crumble and now we're gonna put it together.

You're just gonna scoop a bunch of peach-filling
into the ramekin... Fill it to the top!

Feel free to fill it a little fuller than
normal because it shrinks down in the oven
when they're baking!

All right, once it's filled, you're just gonna
take some crumble- This is the fun part! Ohhhh

I love this, it tastes so good baked! And
just spread it over the top.

Once these are done, it tastes so good- If
you put vanilla ice cream on top too, ooooooh-
Yummy, yummy, yummy!

There they are, they're all ready and then
you can just make as many as you want, and

you're gonna heat your oven to 350 and you're
gonna bake these for 25 minutes.

Once your peach cobblers are done baking,
make sure they've had plenty of time to cool

and now we are gonna add some bling-decorations
to them to make them Princess Peach themed!

I got this yellow paint-pen at Michael's and
we're gonna be drawing little Princess Peach
Crowns on the side of our ramekin.

I thought this was such a cute idea for like
Birthday Parties or Game Night-themed Parties!

The other thing that you're gonna need are
these self-stick gems.

I got this at Michael's as well. We're gonna
be using the color Red and this Royal Blue
color.

Lets decorate and add some bling on these
things!
Ta-daaaaaaaaaaa!

Here are all the Princess Peach Cobblers that
we made today, they smell so good and look
at 'em!
I love the little crowns! So cute! Oooooh!

If you guys have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know!

Leave me a comment down below and I'll do
my best to make it happen!

Also you can follow me on Facebook, Twitter,
Tumblr, Instagram!

I will post lots of pictures of my baking
creations and if you re-create these, please

send me a picture 'cuz I get a big kick out
of seeing baking-creations, it just makes
my day!
All right, thanks you guys! Bye-bye!
